page.title: 07Ecology in Knypersley.
page.content: The area has two main ecological features,Greenway Bank Country Park and Bemersley waste disposal tip. Greenway Bank Country Park lies one mile off the A527 on the Bemersley to Brown Edge road.It consists of several types of ecosystems typified by Beech; Oak;Sycamore;Silver Birch;Ash;and Rowan trees.The scrubland has characteristic vetation of Bramble;Gorse;Tormentil;Rye Grass;Cocksfoot and Rose Bay Willow Herb.Also in this habitat are a number of Rhododendron shrubs,planted when the park was privately owned.Meadowland accounts for a small percentage of the park.The Serpentine lake is the habitat of fish such as pike and roach.It is used as a resting place by water fowl. Bemersley tip is a colliery spoil heap and is slowly being recolonised by the process of succession.
